message_2:
1. {1} is open since it is a member of the topology T.

2. {2} is neither open nor closed. It is not a member of T, so it is not open. Its complement in X is {1, 3}, which is also not a member of T, so it is not closed.

3. {3} is closed. Its complement in X is {1, 2}, which is a member of T, so {3} is closed.

4. {1, 2} is open since it is a member of the topology T.

5. {2, 3} is closed. Its complement in X is {1}, which is a member of T, so {2, 3} is closed.

6. {1, 2, 3} is closed since it is the complement of the empty set {}, which is a member of T.
